intro: Seseli condensatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf seseli, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. Seseli condensatum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a minor component of local flora.
